title: Riemann mapping theorem
summary: In complex analysis, the Riemann mapping theorem states that if U {\displaystyle U} is a non-empty simply connected open subset of the complex number plane C {\displaystyle \mathbb {C} } which is not all of C {\displaystyle \mathbb {C} } , then there exists a biholomorphic mapping f {\displaystyle f} (i.e. a bijective holomorphic mapping whose inverse is also holomorphic) from U {\displaystyle U} onto the open unit disk
